snippet: The digital filmmaking department created a bachelor’s program, with the filmmaker Nicolás Pereda at the helm. But many students were upset by the departure of a popular director.
abstract: Decision by Rutgers University in Sept 2015 to appoint Nicolas Pereda to head undergraduate digital filmmaking program at its Mason Gross School of the Arts met with controversy; students under guidance of predecessor Dena Seidel 2016 San Francisco International Film Festival prize, and Seidel insists she was unfairly dismissed (Metropolitan/New Jersey).
lead_paragraph: The digital filmmaking department created a bachelor’s program, with the filmmaker Nicolás Pereda at the helm. But many students were upset by the departure of a popular director.

headline.print_headline: Amid Conflict, Rutgers Acquires a Noted Filmmaker
headline.main: Amid Conflict, Rutgers Acquires a Noted Filmmaker
